item.text: Then God blessed Noah and his sons and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth.

<st data-num="05921 03605">Every</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">living creature</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> and <st data-num="05921 03605">every</st> <st data-num="05775" class="">bird</st> of the <st data-num="08064" class="">sky</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="02844 04172">terrified</st> of you.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">Everything</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="07430" class="">creeps</st> on the <st data-num="0127" class="">ground</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01709" class="">fish</st> of the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">are</st> under your <st data-num="03027" class="">authority</st>.<n id="2" />
You may eat any moving thing that lives. As I gave you the green plants, I now give you everything.
“But you must not eat meat with its life (that is, its blood) in it.

For your lifeblood I will surely exact punishment, from every living creature I will exact punishment. From each person I will exact punishment for the life of the individual since the man was his relative.

“Whoever sheds human blood,

by other humans

must his blood be shed;

for in God’s image

God has made humankind.
“But as for you, be fruitful and multiply; increase abundantly on the earth and multiply on it.”
God said to Noah and his sons,

“<st data-num="02005" class="">Look</st>. <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> now <st data-num="06965" class="">confirm</st><n id="1" /> my <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you <st data-num="0854" class="">and</st> your <st data-num="02233" class="">descendants</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> you<n id="2" />

and <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">living</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">creature</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> is <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you, including the <st data-num="05775" class="">birds</st>, the <st data-num="0929" class="">domestic animals</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">living creature</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> those that <st data-num="03318" class="">came out</st> of the <st data-num="08392" class="">ark</st> with you—<st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">living creature</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>.<n id="1" />
I confirm my covenant with you: Never again will all living things be wiped out by the waters of a flood; never again will a flood destroy the earth.”
And God said, “This is the guarantee of the covenant I am making with you and every living creature with you, a covenant for all subsequent generations:

I will <st data-num="05414" class="">place</st><n id="1" /> my <st data-num="07198" class="">rainbow</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="06051" class="">clouds</st>, and it will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st><n id="3" /> a <st data-num="0226" class="">guarantee</st> of the <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> me <st data-num="0996" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>.

<st data-num="01961" class="">Whenever</st><n id="1" /> I <st data-num="06049" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="06051" class="">clouds</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> and the <st data-num="07198" class="">rainbow</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">appears</st> in the <st data-num="06051" class="">clouds</st>,

then I will <st data-num="02142" class="">remember</st> my <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st> <st data-num="0834 0996 0996">with</st> you<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0996" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">living</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">creatures</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="01320" class="">kinds</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">Never</st> <st data-num="05750" class="">again</st> will the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> a <st data-num="03999" class="">flood</st> and <st data-num="07843" class="">destroy</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="01320" class="">living things</st>.<n id="4" />
When the rainbow is in the clouds, I will notice it and remember the perpetual covenant between God and all living creatures of all kinds that are on the earth.”
So God said to Noah, “This is the guarantee of the covenant that I am confirming between me and all living things that are on the earth.”
The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. (Now Ham was the father of Canaan.)
These were the three sons of Noah, and from them the whole earth was populated.
Noah, a man of the soil, began to plant a vineyard.

When he <st data-num="08354" class="">drank</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st>, he <st data-num="07937" class="">got drunk</st> and <st data-num="01540" class="">uncovered</st> himself<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08432" class="">inside</st> his <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st>.

<st data-num="02526" class="">Ham</st>, the <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> of <st data-num="03667" class="">Canaan</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="06172" class="">nakedness</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> his <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> who were <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st>.

Shem and Japheth took the garment and placed it on their shoulders. Then they walked in backwards and covered up their father’s nakedness. Their faces were turned the other way so they did not see their father’s nakedness.
When Noah awoke from his drunken stupor he learned what his youngest son had done to him.

So he said,

“Cursed be Canaan!

The lowest of slaves

he will be to his brothers.”

He also said,

“Worthy of praise is the Lord, the God of Shem!

May Canaan be the slave of Shem!

May God enlarge Japheth’s territory and numbers!

May he live in the tents of Shem

and may Canaan be the slave of Japheth!”
After the flood Noah lived 350 years.
The entire lifetime of Noah was 950 years, and then he died.
